Nastêpnie wybierz proporcje. Jeœli chcesz rozpocz¹æ grê, kliknij na przycisku "Rozpocznij grê", a jeœli chcesz z niej zrezygnowaæ, wciœnij przycisk "Przerwij grê".

C_VIEWQUEST.rollover: Naucz siê jak przegl¹daæ aktualne misje
C_VIEWQUEST.detail: Przycisk "Przejrzyj aktualne misje" jest dostêpny tylko wtedy, jeœli gra toczy siê w trybie misji. Nie zaznaczaj ¿adnych jednostek, tylko kliknij na tym przycisku, jeœli jest dostêpny, a zobaczysz aktualne cele misji.

HT_COLLECTRES.rollover: Dowiedz siê wiêcej o tym jak zbieraæ surowce.
HT_COLLECTRES.detail: Surowce potrzebne s¹ do produkcji wieœniaków, jednostek bojowych, machin oblê¿niczych i statków. U¿ywa siê ich tak¿e do szkolenia i ulepszania jednostek, wznoszenia budynków i struktur obronnych oraz przy prowadzeniu badañ nad nowymi technologiami. Do powiêkszania iloœci surowców, które znajduj¹ siê w Twoim skarbcu, przyczyniaj¹ siê wieœniacy, którzy œcinaj¹ drzewa, prowadz¹ wydobycie kamienia i z³ota, ³owi¹ ryby i doj¹ krowy. Dziêki niektórym technologiom mo¿na zwiêkszyæ produktywnoœæ wieœniaków przy gromadzeniu surowców. Innym sposobem na wzbogacenie skarbca jest prowadzenie wymiany handlowej.

HT_PRODUCE_ARMY.detail: To have a powerful kingdom and fught against enemies every player has to produce an army. The main building in which military units are created is the barracks. There are a number of units, which don't need any special technologies to be researched in order to be build. The numerous an army is, the more power it has. One can balance the advantages of the different types of units - infantry, mounted or siege weapons, to make his troops stronger. There are some creatures, which can be summoned in the Magic gateways. They are of great help for every army. To be able to summon them, the player has to capture the Magic workshop first.

HT_TRAIN_UNITS.detail: Each unit has its own attack, defense and health parameters. The units can gain experience in combat. For example, one veteran unit can beat several "newbee" units of the same kind. Military units can be trained, by building dummies, after exploring the Tactics technology. Thus their experience parameter is increased.

HT_HEAL_UNITS.detail: Priests can heal units to recover their health parameter, when it has been lowered in combat. The Healing technology is needed. When a priest heals the troops as they attack - they can reach higher levels, by gaining more experience. Another way to heal units is to make them enter an Outpost.

HT_GARRISON_UNITS.rollover: Learn how to Garrison and ungarrison units.
HT_GARRISON_UNITS.brief: How to Garrison and ungarrison units

HT_USE_SHIPS.rollover: Learn how to Transport units with ships.
HT_USE_SHIPS.brief: How to Transport units with ships
HT_USE_SHIPS.detail: Units can be transported over water with ships. Each ship has a certain amount of units it can load 8 for the Xebec, 16 for the Hulk and 24 for the Galleon. The Landing tactics technology, researched in the Harbor allows ships to carry 50% more units.

HT_USE_MAGIC_CARPETS.rollover: Learn how to Transport units with Magic carpets.
HT_USE_MAGIC_CARPETS.brief: How to Transport units with Magic carpets
HT_USE_MAGIC_CARPETS.detail: Magic carpets are spawned by the Arabian mages. They can transport units over water, as well as over ground. Each Magic carpet can carry up to 8 units. Magic carpets are a good unit to explore the map with too.

HT_UPGRADE_TOWERS.detail: There are several types of towers in Tzar. However only the Watch towers can be built. All other towers, except the Rocket tower,  can be upgraded form the Watch towers. The  Architecture and Cannon Towers technologies are needed to upgrade the Watch towers. The order button for the next possible upgrade appears after each new upgrade.

HT_CREATE_ITEMS.rollover: Learn more about how to Create Items.
HT_CREATE_ITEMS.detail: Items can be created only in the Arabian Magic Workshop, after the Witchcraft technology is researched. Select a Magic Workshop. Click on the Build Magic Item Order Button. The menu for producing Items appears. Choose the type of object to be produced. Choose the amount of gold you are ready to spend. Select Start to produce the Item. Select Cancel to quit.

HT_USE_ITEMS.rollover: Learn more about how to Use Items.
HT_USE_ITEMS.detail: Items can be picked up, by issuing the Pick up order, or simply Right-clicking on them. The Items in an unit's inventory can be used, by selecting them and Left-clicking on the location to be used on. Items can be dropped by holding the Alt key, while selecting the item in the inventory and pointing at the location to be placed.

HT_BUY_ITEMS.rollover: Learn more about how to Buy Items.
HT_BUY_ITEMS.detail: Items can be bought and sold only in the Asian Market, after the Jewelery technology is researched. Select a Market. Click on the Buy Item Order Button. The Item appears on the ground, next to the Market. To sell an item, select a Market. All the Items in your units' posession appear in its inventory. Move the cursor over the item you are willing to sell. The amount of gold you will receive appears in the help text line. Select the Item you want to sell. Gold is added to your treasury.

HT_VIEW_QUESTS.rollover: Learn how to view current Quests.
HT_VIEW_QUESTS.brief: How to to view current Quests
HT_VIEW_QUESTS.detail: Quests appear in campaigns. They give the player directives to follow, in order to accomplishe a certain mission. All quests available can be examined by clicking on the "See current quests" button in the orders bar.

HT_BUILD.rollover: Learn more about how to Build Structures.
HT_BUILD.detail: Only the Peasant unit can build structures. Select a peasant. Click on the Build Button in the Orders Bar or "B" on the keyboard. Select the type of building to be constructed in the Orders Bar. Point at the location of the building on the map. If the structure can be erected on the chosen location the image will be green. Some buildings require certain technologies to be researched, in order to be erected.

HT_CAPTURE_BUILDINGS.rollover: Learn more about how to Capture Buildings.
HT_CAPTURE_BUILDINGS.detail: Buildings can be captured only by peasants. The player can issue the "Capture" order from the orders bar or simply Right-click on an enemy building. The closer a building is to the castle - the harder it is to be captured.

HT_COMMANDS.detail: Commands can be issued by the buttons on the Orders bar, or by a combination of Right/Left-clicking for the most common of them. There are many commands, which can be given from the Keyboard with the Hotkeys.

HT_TRADE_SHIPS.rollover: Learn how to Trade with ships.
HT_TRADE_SHIPS.detail: You have to research the Trade Routes technology and have at least two Harbors and a ship, to be able to trade. Example: One ship brings wood from Harbor A and unloads it at Hrabor B. From Harbor B it loads stone and unloads it at Harbor A. The profit depends on the distance between the two Harbors and the quantity of carried resources. The higher the distance is-the bigger the profit. You can choose the type of the profit you win - Gold, Stone, Wood or Food.

HT_TRADE_CARAVANS.rollover: Learn how to Trade with caravans.
HT_TRADE_CARAVANS.detail: You have to research the Trade Routes technology and have at least to Markets and a caravan/asian peasant, to be able to trade. Example: One caravan/peasant brings wood from Market A and unloads it at Market B. From Market B it loads stone and unloads it at Market A. The profit depends on the distance between the two markets and the quantity of carried resources. The higher the distance is-the bigger the profit. You can choose the type of the profit you win - Gold, Stone, Wood or Food.

HT_BRIBE.detail: Arabian and European peasants can bribe enemy units. You need to research the Bribery technology in the Merchant' Guild.

HT_GAMBLE.rollover: Learn how to Gamble in taverns.
HT_GAMBLE.detail: Gambling is performed in taverns. You have to research the Gambling technology first. Select a Tavern. Click on the Gamble Button in the Orders Bar. Select the type of resource you want to put down. Select the amount of resource you want to put down. Select the proportion. Click Gamble to  start. Click the Cancel button to quit.

HT_REMOVE.rollover: Learn how to Remove troops and structures.
HT_REMOVE.brief: How to Remove troops and structures
HT_REMOVE.detail: Units and buildings can be removed by selecting them and pressing the Del key on the Keyboard. If this is done in the beginning of the building of a structure, the amount of resources it has costed is added back to the treasury. Enemy units or buildings can not be removed in this way.

HT_GATHER_FOOD.detail: Food can be gathered by harvesting fields, fishing with boats and tending cows. Peasants tend the fields and harvest them. They carry the food to the farm or the catsle. If the player has researched the Domestication technology, he can produce cows and milk them for food. The Fishing boats are produced in the harbors.They can gather food from the fish-patches in the seas and store it in the harbors.

HT_TEND_COWS.detail: If the player has researched the Domestication technology, he can produce cows and milk them for food.The Peasant can tend more than one cow, milking it and bringing the milk to the farm or the castle. Cows can be killed, and their meat gathered by the peasants or other units.

HT_TEND_FIELDS.detail: The fields produce the food resource. They need constant care. If they are neglected, they will disappear. It is reasonable to place them around a Farm or the the Castle, for the harvesters to be more efficient in storing the food. The Rotating Fields and Irrigation technologies increase the amount of food carried by peasants. Only one peasant can tend each field.

HT_CHOP_WOOD.detail: Wood can be gathered by cutting trees. Only peasants can chop trees. Wood is stored in the Lumber mill. The closer it is to the trees - the more efficient the woodcutters are.The Saw technology increases the amount of wood carried by peasants.

HT_MINE.rollover: Learn how to Mine Gold and Stone.
HT_MINE.brief: How to Mine Gold and Stone
HT_MINE.detail: Gold and Stone are found as rocks on the map. They can be mined by peasants. Each location contains a certain amount of the resource. Select a location to see the amount of resources it contains. It appears in the Selection View as a number. Gold and Stone are gathered in the Storage or in the Castle. The Gold/Stone Mining technology increases the amount of gold/stone carried by peasants.

HT_BUILD_WALLS_GATES.rollover: Learn how to build Walls and Gates.
HT_BUILD_WALLS_GATES.brief: How to build Walls and Gates
HT_BUILD_WALLS_GATES.detail: Peasants can build walls and gates. Select the Build Wall order button and point the starting location and holding left mouse button drag to the end location. The wall appears green where it can be built. Gates can be placed over already erected walls or at any other approapriate location. While placing a gate you can change it's direction by holding down the Alt or Ctrl key. Only wooden walls and gates can be built. If the Architecture technology has been reseached you can upgrade them to stone ones.

HT_BUILD_BRIDGES.detail: Bridges can be build when you have researched the Architecture technology in the Castle. While placing a bridge you can change it's direction by holding down the Alt key.

HT_UPGRADE_SHIPS.detail: Ships' cannons can be upgraded so they will fire more frequently. You can upgrade cannons up to level six.

HT_REQRUIT.rollover: Learn how to reqruit Mercenaries and Heroes.
HT_REQRUIT.brief: How to reqruit Mercenaries and Heroes
HT_REQRUIT.detail: You can hire mercenaries and heroes in the Taverns, but first you need to research the Mercenaries and Heroes' Quest technologies in the Warriors' Guild. You can hire differnt types of units of all races. Mercenaries and Heroes gather in taverns with time.

WI_TRADE.detail: Trade is an alternative way to increase the resources in a kingdom's treasury. There are several types of trade in Tzar.

WI_ITEMS.rollover: Learn more about what an Item is.
WI_ITEMS.detail: Items are small objects on the map. Units can pick them up and use them. Items can be produced in certain buildings. Only the Arabian mages are able to produce items in the magic workshops, only after they have discovered the necessary technology - Whitchcrafts. There are several categories of items: Weapon, Armor, Spell Books, Scrolls, Potions, Resource Items. There are no Items impossible to build, but better Items cost more and take more time to be produced. Asian Markets can trade Items, after the Jewelery technology is researched.

WI_SPELLS.detail: A Spell is a magical event, which requires a certain technology to be researched in order to happen. Only mages can cast spells. Some spells spawn units, others inflict damage or heal units. Each spell needs a certain amount of manna, to be cast. Spells are foud in the Spell Books Items as well. Any unit can cast a spell from a Spell Book Item, as long as it is in its posession.

WI_BUILDING.detail: Buildings are the places where units are created and technologies are researched. They are unique for each race. There are three groups of buildings for each race: Guilds, Common and Rare.

WI_RACE.detail: There are three races in Tzar - European, Arabian and Asian. Each race has its own unique buildings, units and technologies. They are carefully balanced, so that each of them takes full advantage of its distinguishing features and levels of technological mastery.

WI_TECHNOLOGY.detail: By creating different edifices, the player gains several developmental options to choose from. The various types of technology form a complicated structure called the Technology Tree.

WI_UNIT.detail: The unit is the main instrument for playing. Most of the units can be produced in the buildings. To produce a unit, one must have achieved the adequate amount of resources and technology. Different units require different resources. There are units that have to be spawned by mages. Other units can be summoned in Magic gateways.

WI_COMMANDS.detail: Commands are the way to manage units. When a unit is selected, it can be ordered to perform different actions. The available commands appear as Order Buttons in the interface. Not all orders are optional for all units. They depend on the unit type and level of the researched technologies obtained by the unit.

WI_POP_LIMIT.detail: The Population limit is the maximum number of units a player can have in a game. It can be established in the setup of the game, before it starts. It is impossible to create more units, than the Population Limit allows. Houses are vital for the amount of units a player can produce at a certain moment. Each house increases the number of units, that can be produced by 10. However, this number can not exceede the Population limit established for the game.

WI_STRATEGIES.rollover: Learn what Strategies there are in Tzar
WI_STRATEGIES.detail: Once the player has developed the kingdom, he can choose between four different strategies to play: the Way of Glory, the Way of Religion, the Way of Magic, and the Way of Trade and Crafts. Each strategy is represented by a particular building - the Warriors gild, the Cathedral/Mosque/Shao Linn temple, the Mages' Tower, the Merchants' Guild. The way selected will define different technologies to invent unique units and buildings.

WI_SIEGE_WEAPON.detail: Catapults Heavy Catapults and Ballistas are siege weapons. They are produced in workshops. They cost only wood, but the Heavy catapult needs the Siege Tactics technology to be researched. Siege weapons are a great power against fortified enemy kingdoms. They inflict damage on all units, not only on enemy ones. Peasants can repair damaged weapons if you have the required amount of wood. Select a peasant, click on the Repair button in the Orders Bar and then point at the damaged siege weapon, or simply right-click on the one that needs to be repaired.

HOTKEYS.Double click on a unit: Selects all units of the same type on the screen
HOTKEYS.Ctrl + Double click: Selects all units of the same type, and with the same current state, that can be commanded by the player on the screen
HOTKEYS.Alt + Double Click: Selects all military or non-military units that can be commanded by the player on the screen
HOTKEYS.Ctrl + Digit (1-9): When units are selected, assigns the number to the selected group
HOTKEYS.Digit (1-9): Selects a group previously defined with Control + Digit
HOTKEYS.Right click when a unit is selected: Performs the unit's default action at the desired location
HOTKEYS.Ctrl + Enter: Sends the current location to allies (location is visible on the mini-map)
HOTKEYS.Ctrl + Shift + Enter: Sends the current location to enemies and allies (location is visible on the mini-map)
HOTKEYS.Ctrl + Right click when a unit is select: Move and attack every visible enemy unit
